metadata.name: Collective and Swarm Sensing
metadata.description: Collective proprioception and swarm awareness capabilities for multi-agent and distributed AI systems, covering formation sensing, consensus estimation, and distributed health monitoring. These concepts enable interpretability of how distributed agents perceive their collective state.
metadata.author: hatcat-team
metadata.changelog: v0.2.0: Augmented training examples to meet validation thresholds (15 for harness_relevant, 5 for standard)

candidates.definition: The sensory modality through which individual agents perceive the configuration, state, and health of the collective or swarm they belong to
candidates.definition_source: Swarm robotics, multi-agent systems, collective intelligence

simplex_mapping.unmapped_justification: Sensory modality category for distributed systems

positive_examples: Collective proprioception allowed each drone to sense its position within the formation.
The swarm's distributed self-perception detected the gap left by the failed unit.
Collective awareness indicated the formation was drifting from the target configuration.
Swarm proprioception provided each agent with a sense of the collective's shape and motion.
Each agent's collective proprioception provided a sense of the swarm's overall momentum and direction.
negative_examples: The agents were in a group.
training_hints.disambiguation: Individual agent's perception of collective state, not external observation of swarm

candidates.definition: Perceiving the presence, identity, state, and relative position of neighboring agents in the collective
candidates.definition_source: Local interaction, neighbor detection, proximity sensing

positive_examples: Agent neighborhood sensing detected three neighbors within communication range.
Local neighbor awareness indicated the adjacent drone was veering off course.
Proximity sensing maintained safe separation while tracking neighbor velocities.
Neighborhood perception updated the local graph topology after a new agent joined.
Neighborhood sensing detected the approaching agent was moving too fast for safe rendezvous.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active perception of neighbor states, not mere proximity

candidates.definition: Estimating the overall spatial configuration, shape, and arrangement of the collective from local observations

positive_examples: Swarm configuration estimation reconstructed the formation shape from local inter-agent measurements.
Each agent's configuration estimate converged to the true swarm geometry through gossip averaging.
The distributed estimator tracked the swarm's bounding ellipse parameters.
Configuration awareness detected that the swarm had split into two subgroups.
Configuration estimation detected the swarm had elongated along the wind direction.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distributed estimation of collective configuration, not central observation

candidates.definition: Perceiving the distribution of workload, resources, or task assignments across the collective to enable balancing
candidates.definition_source: Load balancing, task allocation, resource distribution

positive_examples: Collective load balancing awareness detected uneven task distribution requiring reallocation.
Load sensing indicated some agents were idle while others were overloaded.
The distributed load perception triggered task migration to underutilized agents.
Resource balance awareness identified the bottleneck agent limiting throughput.
Load awareness triggered task shedding from the overloaded nodes to their underutilized neighbors.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distributed perception of load imbalance, not central scheduler view

candidates.definition: Sensing and maintaining desired geometric relationships among agents in a formation

positive_examples: Formation control maintained the V-shaped pattern while navigating through the corridor.
Each agent's formation sensing tracked its offset from the virtual leader.
Formation control detected and corrected the spacing error with the starboard neighbor.
The formation controller reconfigured from line to diamond formation on command.
Formation sensing adjusted each agent's velocity to maintain constant separation during the turn.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active sensing and control of formation geometry, not passive pattern membership

candidates.definition: Perceiving the degree of agreement among agents on shared variables, decisions, or beliefs

positive_examples: Consensus state estimation showed the swarm was converging on a shared heading estimate.
Agreement sensing detected that three agents held divergent target location beliefs.
Consensus monitoring indicated the voting protocol had reached supermajority agreement.
The consensus estimator tracked the variance reduction across distributed estimates.
Consensus monitoring showed the variance in heading estimates was still decreasing with each exchange.
training_hints.disambiguation: Perception of agreement state and convergence, not fact of agreement

candidates.definition: Perceiving how information, commands, or influence propagates through the communication network of the collective

positive_examples: Signal propagation awareness detected that the command was taking 5 hops to reach the edge agents.
Network flow sensing identified the bottleneck link limiting information dissemination.
Propagation awareness showed the wavefront of the alert spreading through the swarm.
Communication topology perception revealed the swarm had partitioned into isolated clusters.
Propagation awareness showed the warning signal had reached the perimeter faster than expected.
training_hints.disambiguation: Awareness of information flow dynamics, not message passing

candidates.definition: Sensing the overall operational health, capability, and degradation state of the collective

positive_examples: Swarm health monitoring indicated 15% of agents were operating in degraded mode.
Collective health sensing detected a gradual decline in average battery reserves.
Swarm integrity assessment showed the formation could sustain two more losses.
Health monitoring aggregated individual status into an overall swarm readiness metric.
Distributed health sensing revealed the swarm's mean latency had increased 40% over the last hour.
Collective health assessment indicated three agents were approaching thermal limits.
The swarm's self-diagnosis showed 92% operational capacity with two units in standby.
Health monitoring detected divergent clock skew across the eastern cluster.
Collective integrity sensing flagged that redundancy margins were below the mission threshold.
Swarm health perception revealed asymmetric degradation concentrated in the oldest units.
Distributed monitoring detected memory pressure building across multiple agents simultaneously.
Collective health awareness triggered preventive measures before cascading failures occurred.
The swarm's health summary indicated good overall status but elevated error rates in communication.
Integrity monitoring reported the collective was still mission-capable despite recent losses.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distributed perception of collective health, not central status dashboard

candidates.definition: Detecting and localizing failures, faults, or anomalies within the collective through distributed sensing

positive_examples: Collective failure localization identified the malfunctioning agent through neighbor reports.
Distributed fault detection triangulated the communication failure to the northeastern sector.
Failure localization distinguished between an agent crash and communication loss.
The swarm's collective diagnosis pinpointed the agent sending corrupted messages.
Distributed sensing localized the fault to agent #47 based on correlated timeout reports.
Failure detection identified the common link between all agents experiencing packet loss.
Collective diagnosis traced the cascade origin to a single sensor malfunction.
Fault localization used neighbor testimony to identify the Byzantine agent.
Distributed troubleshooting narrowed the problem from 'somewhere in sector B' to 'agent B-12.'
Collective failure sensing determined the root cause was a shared dependency, not individual faults.
Localization through neighbor voting identified agent #23 as the source of invalid broadcasts.
Failure detection correlated timing information to pinpoint where the propagation broke down.
Distributed diagnosis distinguished between a failed agent and an agent isolated by network partition.
Collective fault sensing reconstructed the failure timeline from distributed logs.
training_hints.disambiguation: Distributed localization and characterization of failures, not failure occurrence

candidates.definition: Perceiving how well the collective's emergent behavior aligns with the intended global objectives

positive_examples: Global goal alignment assessment detected the swarm's emergent behavior was converging toward the target.
Collective objective sensing indicated the local rules were producing the intended global pattern.
Goal alignment perception revealed drift between the swarm's trajectory and the mission objective.
The distributed assessment indicated 80% of agents were contributing effectively to the collective goal.
Alignment monitoring detected the emergent behavior was achieving the objective but via an unexpected path.
Global coherence assessment showed the swarm was optimizing for speed when the goal prioritized coverage.
Collective goal sensing revealed that local adaptations had preserved alignment despite environment changes.
Alignment assessment flagged that individual utility-seeking was undermining collective objective progress.
Distributed goal monitoring detected the swarm had achieved the intermediate milestone ahead of schedule.
Global alignment perception revealed the formation was drifting toward a local optimum, not the global one.
Collective assessment showed strong alignment on primary objectives but drift on secondary constraints.
Goal coherence sensing detected that the swarm's emergent strategy matched the intended design.
Alignment monitoring identified which agents' behaviors were most responsible for collective progress.
Distributed objective assessment revealed the swarm was 70% converged on the consensus target location.
training_hints.disambiguation: Assessment of collective behavior alignment with objectives, not goal completion
